pkgmetadata.longdescription: # python-slapd [![Documentation Status](https://readthedocs.org/projects/slapd/badge/?version=latest)](https://slapd.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest)Controls your OpenLDAP process in a pythonic way.```pip install slapd``````python>>> import slapd>>> process = slapd.Slapd()>>> process.start()>>> process.ldapwhoami().stdout.decode("utf-8")'dn:cn=manager,dc=slapd-test,dc=python-ldap,dc=org\n'>>> process.stop()```# TroubleshootingOn distributions like Ubuntu, apparmor may restrict *slapd* to access some files that*python-slapd* has generated. This situation can be solved by passing slapd in complain mode:```bashsudo apt install --yes apparmor-utilssudo aa-complain /usr/sbin/slapd```
